This plugin lets you export graphical elements (assets) as SVG files from any selected Frame in Figma.


When you run the plugin:

1. It scans the selected frame for valid exportable elements (e.g., VECTORS, ICONS, COMPONENTS).

2. Youâ€™ll see a list of assets with preview thumbnails, names, and their Figma types.

3. You can filter by type, toggle selection, and bulk-select assets.

4. Clicking â€œExport Selectionâ€ downloads all selected assets as a clean ZIP file of SVGs.


How to use it:

â€¢ Select a Frame that contains the assets you want to export.

â€¢ Launch the plugin.

â€¢ Use the filters, select assets, and export.


Current limitations:

â€¢ Only one Frame can be selected at a time.

â€¢ Only elements that support SVG export will be included (e.g., no bitmaps or text layers).

â€¢ Does not automatically react to new selections â€” use the â€œRefresh Selectionâ€ button manually when needed.

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. Itâ€™s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figmaâ€™s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

â€¢ Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layerâ€™s text to "Hello World".


â€¢ Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layerâ€™s text to "Welcome".


â€¢ Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


â€¢ Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


â€¢ Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


â€¢ Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or youâ€™ll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out

Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click â€œEnable Arabic Modeâ€ or â€œDisable Arabic Modeâ€
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties â€” please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.description:

This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they donâ€™t rely on our service and theyâ€™re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.

plugins.name: Size Sync
plugins.description:
A convenient plugin for aligning sizes of multiple selected objects. Easily batch resize objects to match maximum/minimum widths or heights. plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figmaâ€™s local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

plugins.name: Frame Navigator
plugins.description:
ðŸ§­ FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator â€” a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


âœ¨ Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarityâ€”perfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


ðŸ›  How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. âš ï¸ Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

plugins.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
plugins.description:
ðŸ”® NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




âœ¨ Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



ðŸ› ï¸ How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.

plugins.name: Icons to GitLab
